sources.description:

Featuring Jackie Coogan as Oliver and Lon Chaney as the sinister Fagin, this version is both historically significant and emotionally powerful.

Plot Summary:
Set in 19th-century England, Oliver Twist (Jackie Coogan) is a poor orphan born in a workhouse who grows up facing cruelty, neglect, and exploitation. After escaping harsh treatment, he falls into the clutches of Fagin (Lon Chaney), a manipulative criminal who trains children to become pickpockets. Caught between the innocence of his own heart and the corruption of the world around him, Oliver struggles to find safety, kindness, and belonging. His fate takes a turn when Mr. Brownlow (Tully Marshall), a wealthy gentleman, offers him protection, but Fagin and his ruthless accomplices are unwilling to let Oliver go.

This adaptation is notable for its emotional intensity and the performances of its two leads: Jackie Coogan, one of the greatest child actors of the silent era, and Lon Chaney, known as ‚ÄúThe Man of a Thousand Faces,‚Äù who delivers one of his most unforgettable portrayals as the sinister Fagin. The film‚Äôs visual storytelling, strong performances, and faithful treatment of Dickens‚Äô narrative made it a landmark production in early cinema.

This 1922 production is among the most famous silent film versions of Oliver Twist. Released by First National Pictures, it solidified Jackie Coogan‚Äôs reputation following his success in Charlie Chaplin‚Äôs The Kid (1921) and demonstrated Lon Chaney‚Äôs unmatched ability to embody complex villains. Though many silent films have been lost, this version survives and is celebrated for its faithful Dickensian atmosphere, its powerful performances, and its contribution to the legacy of literary adaptations in Hollywood.

metadata.Plot: Oliver's mother, a penniless outcast, died giving birth to him. As a young boy Oliver is brought up in a workhouse, later apprenticed to an uncaring undertaker, and eventually is taken in by a gang of thieves who befriend him for their own purposes. All the while, there are secrets from Oliver's family history waiting to come to light.
